description: Smallest power of 2 that begins with n.
links: Christian N. K. Anderson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..981 (a(982) has 1196 digits)
example: a(7) = 70368744177664, because 2^46 is the smallest power of 2 that begins with a 7.
prog: (R) library(gmp); ndig<-function(i) nchar(as.character(as.bigz(i))) y=as.bigz(rep(0,100)); for(i in 1:100) {n=as.bigz(2); while(substr(n,1,ndig(i))!=as.character(i)) n=n*2; y[i]=n; } # _Christian N. K. Anderson_, May 23 2013
author: _David W. Wilson_
